57 typedef struct tz_decode_info TZ_DECODE_INFO;
58 struct tz_decode_info
59 {
60  TZ_REGION_TYPE type; /* 0 : offset ; 1 : zone + DST */
61  union
62  {
63  int offset; /* in seconds */
64  struct
65  {
66  unsigned int zone_id; /* geographical zone id */
67  unsigned int offset_id; /* GMT offset rule id; MAX_INT if not yet determined */
68  unsigned int dst_id; /* daylight rule id ; MAX_INT if not yet determined */
69  char dst_str[TZ_DS_STRING_SIZE];
70 
71  TZ_TIMEZONE *p_timezone;
72  TZ_OFFSET_RULE *p_zone_off_rule;
73  TZ_DS_RULE *p_ds_rule;
74  } zone;
75  };
76 };

181 #if defined(WINDOWS)
182 #define TZ_GET_SYM_ADDR(lib, sym) GetProcAddress((HMODULE)lib, sym)
183 #else
184 #define TZ_GET_SYM_ADDR(lib, sym) dlsym(lib, sym)
185 #endif
186 
187 #define TZLIB_GET_ADDR(v, SYM_NAME, SYM_TYPE, lh) \
188  do { \
189  v = (SYM_TYPE) TZ_GET_SYM_ADDR (lh, SYM_NAME); \
190  if (v == NULL) \
191  { \
192  strncpy (sym_name, (SYM_NAME), sizeof (sym_name) - 1); \
193  sym_name[sizeof (sym_name) - 1] = '\0'; \
194  goto error_loading_symbol; \
195  } \
196  } while (0)
197 
198 #define TZLIB_GET_VAL(v, SYM_NAME, SYM_TYPE, lh) \
199  do { \
200  SYM_TYPE* aux; \
201  TZLIB_GET_ADDR(aux, SYM_NAME, SYM_TYPE*, lh); \
202  v = *aux; \
203  } while (0)
204 
205 #define APPLY_NEXT_OFF_RULE() \
206  do { \
207  prev_off_rule = curr_off_rule; \
208  curr_off_rule = next_off_rule; \
209  next_off_rule = offset_rules[offset_rule_counter++]; \
210  curr_offset_id++; \
211  } while (0)

213 /*
214  * tz_load_library - loads the timezone specific DLL/so
215  * Returns : error code - ER_LOC_INIT if library load fails
216  * - NO_ERROR if success
217  * lib_file(in) : path to library
218  * handle(out) : handle to the loaded library
219  */
220 static int
221 tz_load_library (const char *lib_file, void **handle)
222 {
223  int err_status = NO_ERROR;
224  char err_msg[512];
225 #if defined(WINDOWS)
226  DWORD loading_err;
227  char *lpMsgBuf;
228  UINT error_mode = 0;
229 #else
230  char *error;
231 #endif
232 
233  assert (lib_file != NULL);
234 
235 #if defined(WINDOWS)
236  error_mode = SetErrorMode (SEM_NOOPENFILEERRORBOX | SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS);
237  *handle = LoadLibrary (lib_file);
238  SetErrorMode (error_mode);
239  loading_err = GetLastError ();
240 #elif defined(_AIX)
241  dlerror (); /* Clear any existing error */
242  *handle = dlopen (lib_file, RTLD_NOW | RTLD_MEMBER);
243 #else
244  dlerror (); /* Clear any existing error */
245  *handle = dlopen (lib_file, RTLD_NOW);
246 #endif
247 
248  if (*handle == NULL)
249  {
250  err_status = ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR;
251  }
252 
253  if (err_status == ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR)
254  {
255 #if defined(WINDOWS)
256  FormatMessage (FORMAT_MESSAGE_ALLOCATE_BUFFER | FORMAT_MESSAGE_FROM_SYSTEM | FORMAT_MESSAGE_ARGUMENT_ARRAY, NULL,
257  loading_err, MAKELANGID (LANG_NEUTRAL, SUBLANG_DEFAULT), (char *) &lpMsgBuf, 1,
258  (va_list *) & lib_file);
259  snprintf (err_msg, sizeof (err_msg) - 1,
260  "Library file is invalid or not accessible.\n" " Unable to load %s !\n %s", lib_file, lpMsgBuf);
261  LocalFree (lpMsgBuf);
262 #else
263  error = dlerror ();
264  snprintf (err_msg, sizeof (err_msg) - 1,
265  "Library file is invalid or not accessible.\n" " Unable to load %s !\n %s", lib_file, error);
266 #endif
267  printf ("%s\n", err_msg);
268  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR, 1, err_msg);
269  }
270 
271  return err_status;
272 }
273 
274 /*
275  * tz_load_data_from_lib() - uses the handle to load the data from the timezone shared library into tzd.
276  * Returns: 0 (NO_ERROR) if success, -1 otherwise
277  * tzd(out): TZ_DATA parameter where to load the data into
278  * lib_handle(in): shared library/object handle
279  */
280 static int
281 tz_load_data_from_lib (TZ_DATA * tzd, void *lib_handle)
282 {
283  char sym_name[TZLIB_SYMBOL_NAME_SIZE + 1];
284  char err_msg[512 + PATH_MAX];
285  char *checksum;
286 
287  assert (lib_handle != NULL);
288  assert (tzd != NULL);
289 
290  /* load data from the shared library */
291  TZLIB_GET_VAL (tzd->country_count, "tz_country_count", int, lib_handle);
292  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->countries, "tz_countries", TZ_COUNTRY *, lib_handle);
293 
294  TZLIB_GET_VAL (tzd->timezone_count, "timezone_count", int, lib_handle);
295  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->timezone_names, "tz_timezone_names", char **, lib_handle);
296  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->timezones, "timezones", TZ_TIMEZONE *, lib_handle);
297 
298  TZLIB_GET_VAL (tzd->offset_rule_count, "offset_rule_count", int, lib_handle);
299  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->offset_rules, "offset_rules", TZ_OFFSET_RULE *, lib_handle);
300 
301  TZLIB_GET_VAL (tzd->name_count, "tz_name_count", int, lib_handle);
302  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->names, "tz_names", TZ_NAME *, lib_handle);
303 
304  TZLIB_GET_VAL (tzd->ds_ruleset_count, "ds_ruleset_count", int, lib_handle);
305  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->ds_rulesets, "ds_rulesets", TZ_DS_RULESET *, lib_handle);
306 
307  TZLIB_GET_VAL (tzd->ds_rule_count, "ds_rule_count", int, lib_handle);
308  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->ds_rules, "ds_rules", TZ_DS_RULE *, lib_handle);
309 
310  TZLIB_GET_VAL (tzd->ds_leap_sec_count, "ds_leap_sec_count", int, lib_handle);
311  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->ds_leap_sec, "ds_leap_sec", TZ_LEAP_SEC *, lib_handle);
312 
313 #if defined(WINDOWS)
314  TZLIB_GET_VAL (tzd->windows_iana_map_count, "windows_iana_map_count", int, lib_handle);
315  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (tzd->windows_iana_map, "windows_iana_map", TZ_WINDOWS_IANA_MAP *, lib_handle);
316 #endif
317 
318  TZLIB_GET_ADDR (checksum, "tz_timezone_checksum", char *, lib_handle);
319  strncpy (tzd->checksum, checksum, 32);
320  tzd->checksum[32] = '\0';
321 
322  return NO_ERROR;
323 
324 error_loading_symbol:
325  snprintf (err_msg, sizeof (err_msg) - 1, "Cannot load symbol '%s' from the timezone library file!", sym_name);
326  printf ("%s\n", err_msg);
327  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR, 1, err_msg);
328 
329  return ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR;
330 }
331 
332 /*
333  * tz_load() - opens the timezone library and loads the data into the tzd parameter
334  * Returns: 0 (NO_ERROR) if success, -1 otherwise
335  */
336 int
337 tz_load (void)
338 {
339  int err_status = NO_ERROR;
340  char lib_file[PATH_MAX] = { 0 };
341 
342  if (tz_Initialized)
343  {
344  return err_status;
345  }
346 
347  envvar_libdir_file (lib_file, PATH_MAX, LIB_TZ_NAME);
348  err_status = tz_load_library (lib_file, &tz_Lib_handle);
349 
350  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
351  {
352  goto error_exit;
353  }
354 
355  err_status = tz_load_data_from_lib (&tz_Timezone_data, tz_Lib_handle);
356  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
357  {
358  goto error_exit;
359  }
360 
361  tz_Initialized = 1;
362 
363  return NO_ERROR;
364 
365 error_exit:
366 
367  if (er_errid () == NO_ERROR)
368  {
369  err_status = ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR;
370  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_LOAD_ERROR, 1, lib_file);
371  }
372 
373  return err_status;
374 }
375 
376 /*
377  * tz_unload () - destroy all timezone related data
378  * Returns:
379  */
380 void
381 tz_unload (void)
382 {
383  memset (&tz_Timezone_data, 0, sizeof (tz_Timezone_data));
384 
385  if (tz_Lib_handle != NULL)
386  {
387 #if defined(WINDOWS)
388  FreeLibrary ((HMODULE) tz_Lib_handle);
389 #else
390  dlclose (tz_Lib_handle);
391 #endif
392  tz_Lib_handle = NULL;
393  }
394  tz_Initialized = 0;
395 }

397 /*
398  * tz_get_leapsec_support() - returns true if leap-seconds
399  * are activated and false if not
400  */
401 static bool
402 tz_get_leapsec_support (void)
403 {
404  bool leapsec_support;
405 
406  leapsec_support = prm_get_bool_value (PRM_ID_TZ_LEAP_SECOND_SUPPORT);
407 
408  return leapsec_support;
409 }
410 
411 /*
412  * tz_timestamp_encode_leap_sec_adj() - returns offset in seconds for leap second adjustment
413  */
414 DB_BIGINT
415 tz_timestamp_encode_leap_sec_adj (const int year_century, const int year, const int mon, const int day)
416 {
417  DB_BIGINT t = 0;
418  int len, index;
419  const TZ_DATA *tzd;
420  TZ_LEAP_SEC leap_second;
421 
422  tzd = tz_get_data ();
423 
424  if (tzd == NULL || tz_get_leapsec_support () == false)
425  {
426  return 0;
427  }
428 
429  len = tzd->ds_leap_sec_count;
430  index = 0;
431  while (index < len)
432  {
433  leap_second = tzd->ds_leap_sec[index];
434 
435  if (leap_second.year > year_century + year)
436  {
437  break;
438  }
439  if (leap_second.year == year_century + year)
440  {
441  if ((mon < leap_second.month) || (mon == leap_second.month && day <= leap_second.day))
442  {
443  break;
444  }
445  }
446  index++;
447  }
448  t = index;
449 
450  return t;
451 }
452 
453 /*
454  * tz_timestamp_decode_sec() - extracts from a UNIX timestamp the year, month, day, hour, minute and second
455  *
456  */
457 void
458 tz_timestamp_decode_sec (int timestamp, int *yearp, int *monthsp, int *dayp, int *hoursp, int *minutesp, int *secondsp)
459 {
460  if (tz_get_leapsec_support () == false)
461  {
462  tz_timestamp_decode_no_leap_sec (timestamp, yearp, monthsp, dayp, hoursp, minutesp, secondsp);
463  }
464  else
465  {
466  tz_timestamp_decode_leap_sec_adj (timestamp, yearp, monthsp, dayp, hoursp, minutesp, secondsp);
467  }
468 }
469 
470 /*
471  * tz_timestamp_decode_leap_sec_adj() - returns offset in seconds for leap second adjustment
472  */
473 static void
474 tz_timestamp_decode_leap_sec_adj (int timestamp, int *yearp, int *monthsp, int *dayp, int *hoursp, int *minutesp,
475  int *secondsp)
476 {
477  const int year_base = 1970;
478  const int secs_per_day = 24 * 3600;
479  int index, leap_cnt;
480  int leap, diff, i;
481  int year, months, day;
482  int hours, minutes, seconds;
483  const TZ_DATA *tzd;
484 
485  year = 0;
486  months = 0;
487 
488  tzd = tz_get_data ();
489  index = 0;
490 
491  if (tzd != NULL)
492  {
493  leap_cnt = tzd->ds_leap_sec_count;
494  }
495  else
496  {
497  leap_cnt = 0;
498  }
499 
500  /* get number of years */
501  for (;;)
502  {
503  int days_in_year;
504  leap = 0;
505 
506  if (IS_LEAP_YEAR (year_base + year))
507  {
508  days_in_year = 366;
509  }
510  else
511  {
512  days_in_year = 365;
513  }
514 
515  while (index < leap_cnt && tzd->ds_leap_sec[index].year == year_base + year)
516  {
517  index++;
518  leap++;
519  }
520 
521  if (timestamp - days_in_year * secs_per_day - leap < 0)
522  {
523  index -= leap;
524  break;
525  }
526 
527  timestamp -= days_in_year * secs_per_day + leap;
528  year++;
529  }
530 
531  /* Get the number of months */
532  for (i = TZ_MON_JAN; i <= TZ_MON_DEC; i++)
533  {
534  int subtract = tz_Days_of_month[i] * secs_per_day;
535  leap = 0;
536 
537  /* leap year and february */
538  if (IS_LEAP_YEAR (year_base + year) && i == TZ_MON_FEB)
539  {
540  subtract += secs_per_day;
541  }
542 
543  while (index < leap_cnt && tzd->ds_leap_sec[index].year == year_base + year
544  && tzd->ds_leap_sec[index].month == months)
545  {
546  index++;
547  leap++;
548  }
549 
550  if (timestamp - subtract - leap < 0)
551  {
552  index -= leap;
553  break;
554  }
555  timestamp -= subtract + leap;
556  months++;
557  }
558 
559  /* Get the number of days */
560  day = timestamp / secs_per_day;
561  timestamp = timestamp % secs_per_day;
562  leap = 0;
563 
564  while (index < leap_cnt && tzd->ds_leap_sec[index].year == year_base + year && tzd->ds_leap_sec[index].month == months
565  && tzd->ds_leap_sec[index].day <= day)
566  {
567  index++;
568  leap++;
569  }
570 
571  diff = timestamp - leap;
572  if (diff < 0)
573  {
574  day--;
575  timestamp = secs_per_day + diff;
576  }
577  else
578  {
579  timestamp = diff;
580  }
581  day++;
582 
583  /* Get the hours, minutes and seconds */
584  hours = timestamp / 3600;
585  minutes = (timestamp % 3600) / 60;
586  seconds = (timestamp % 3600) % 60;
587 
588  *yearp = year + year_base;
589  *monthsp = months;
590  *dayp = day;
591  *hoursp = hours;
592  *minutesp = minutes;
593  *secondsp = seconds;
594 }
595 
596 /*
597  * tz_timestamp_decode_no_leap_sec() - extracts from a UNIX timestamp the year, month, day, hour, minute
598  * and second without taking into account leap seconds
599  */
600 void
601 tz_timestamp_decode_no_leap_sec (int timestamp, int *yearp, int *monthsp, int *dayp, int *hoursp, int *minutesp,
602  int *secondsp)
603 {
604  const int year_base = 1970;
605  const int secs_per_day = 24 * 3600;
606  const int days_in_year = 365;
607  const int secs_in_a_year = secs_per_day * days_in_year;
608  int year, month, day;
609  int hours, minutes, seconds;
610  int secs_until_last_year;
611  int secs_until_last_month = 0;
612  int days_last_month;
613 
614  /* Get approximate number of years */
615  year = timestamp / (days_in_year * secs_per_day);
616  secs_until_last_year =
617  year * secs_in_a_year + ((year + 1) / 4) * secs_per_day - ((year + 69) / 100) * secs_per_day +
618  ((year + 369) / 400) * secs_per_day;
619 
620  /* If we overestimated the number of years take back one year */
621  if (timestamp - secs_until_last_year < 0)
622  {
623  year--;
624  secs_until_last_year -= secs_in_a_year;
625  if (IS_LEAP_YEAR (year_base + year))
626  {
627  secs_until_last_year -= secs_per_day;
628  }
629  }
630  timestamp -= secs_until_last_year;
631 
632  /* Get approximate number of months */
633  month = timestamp / (31 * secs_per_day);
634 
635  /* If we underestimated the number of months add another one */
636  if (month > TZ_MON_JAN)
637  {
638  secs_until_last_month = tz_Days_up_to_month[month - 1] * secs_per_day;
639  if (IS_LEAP_YEAR (year_base + year) && month > TZ_MON_FEB)
640  {
641  secs_until_last_month += secs_per_day;
642  }
643  }
644 
645  days_last_month = tz_Days_of_month[month] * secs_per_day;
646  if (IS_LEAP_YEAR (year_base + year) && month == TZ_MON_FEB)
647  {
648  days_last_month += secs_per_day;
649  }
650 
651  if (timestamp - secs_until_last_month - days_last_month >= 0)
652  {
653  secs_until_last_month += days_last_month;
654  month++;
655  }
656 
657  timestamp -= secs_until_last_month;
658 
659  /* Get the number of days */
660  day = timestamp / secs_per_day;
661  day++;
662  timestamp = timestamp % secs_per_day;
663 
664  /* Get the hours, minutes and seconds */
665  hours = timestamp / 3600;
666  minutes = (timestamp % 3600) / 60;
667  seconds = (timestamp % 3600) % 60;
668 
669  *yearp = year + year_base;
670  *monthsp = month;
671  *dayp = day;
672  *hoursp = hours;
673  *minutesp = minutes;
674  *secondsp = seconds;
675 }

763 /*
764  * tz_get_session_tz_region() - get the session timezone region
765  */
766 void
767 tz_get_session_tz_region (TZ_REGION * tz_region)
768 {
769  TZ_REGION *session_tz_region;
770 
771 #if defined(CS_MODE)
772  session_tz_region = tz_get_client_tz_region_session ();
773  *tz_region = *session_tz_region;
774 #else /* SERVER or SA_MODE */
775  if (BO_IS_SERVER_RESTARTED ())
776  {
777 #if defined(SERVER_MODE)
778  session_tz_region = tz_get_server_tz_region_session ();
779 #else
780  session_tz_region = tz_get_client_tz_region_session ();
781 #endif /* SERVER_MODE */
782  if (session_tz_region != NULL)
783  {
784  *tz_region = *session_tz_region;
785  }
786  else
787  {
788  /* A session could not be found with this thread, use invalid region */
789  *tz_region = *tz_get_invalid_tz_region ();
790  }
791  }
792  else
793  {
794  *tz_region = tz_Region_system;
795  }
796 #endif /* CS_MODE */
797 }

847 /*
848  * tz_get_current_date() -
849  *
850  */
851 static DB_DATE
852 tz_get_current_date (void)
853 {
854  DB_DATETIME datetime;
855  time_t time_val;
856  struct tm c_time_struct, *c_time_struct_p;
857 
858  time_val = time (NULL);
859  c_time_struct_p = localtime_r (&time_val, &c_time_struct);
860  if (c_time_struct_p == NULL)
861  {
862  db_datetime_encode (&datetime, 1, 1, 2012, 10, 30, 0, 0);
863  }
864  else
865  {
866  db_datetime_encode (&datetime, c_time_struct_p->tm_mon + 1, c_time_struct_p->tm_mday,
867  c_time_struct_p->tm_year + 1900, c_time_struct_p->tm_hour, c_time_struct_p->tm_min,
868  c_time_struct_p->tm_sec, 0);
869  }
870 
871  return datetime.date;
872 }
873 
874 /*
875  * tz_print_tz_offset () - stores in result in the format hh:mm or hh:mm:ss the number of seconds in tz_offset,
876  * where hh is the number of hours, mm the number of minutes and ss is the number of seconds
877  * hh:mm:ss format is used only if the number of seconds is positive
878  *
879  * tz_offset (in) : timezone offset represented in seconds
880  * result (out) : output timezone offset
881  */
882 
883 static void
884 tz_print_tz_offset (char *result, int tz_offset)
885 {
886  const int sign_hour_minutes = 6;
887  const int seconds = 3;
888  int off_hour, off_min, off_sec, out_len = 0;
889  char sign = '+';
890 
891  if (tz_offset < 0)
892  {
893  sign = '-';
894  tz_offset = -tz_offset;
895  }
896 
897  off_hour = tz_offset / 3600;
898  off_min = (tz_offset % 3600) / 60;
899  off_sec = (tz_offset % 3600) % 60;
900 
901  out_len += sign_hour_minutes;
902  if (off_sec != 0)
903  {
904  out_len += seconds;
905  }
906 
907  if (!off_sec)
908  {
909  snprintf (result, out_len + 1, "%c%02d:%02d", sign, off_hour, off_min);
910  }
911  else
912  {
913  snprintf (result, out_len + 1, "%c%02d:%02d:%02d", sign, off_hour, off_min, off_sec);
914  }
915  (result)[out_len] = '\0';
916 }
917 
918 /*
919  * tz_get_timezone_offset () - puts in result the timezone offset of tz_str timezone
920  * tz_str (in) : name or offset of timezone
921  * tz_size (in) : length of timezone string
922  * utc_datetime (in) : the current UTC datetime
923  * result (out) : the timezone offset
924  */
925 int
926 tz_get_timezone_offset (const char *tz_str, int tz_size, char *result, DB_DATETIME * utc_datetime)
927 {
928  const char *p = tz_str;
929  int error = NO_ERROR;
930 
931  while (p < tz_str + tz_size && char_isspace (*p))
932  {
933  p++;
934  }
935 
936  if (p >= tz_str + tz_size)
937  {
938  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
939  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
940  }
941 
942  if (*p == '+' || *p == '-')
943  {
944  int seconds = 0;
945  const char *zone_end;
946  if (tz_str_to_seconds (p, tz_str + tz_size, &seconds, &zone_end, true) != NO_ERROR)
947  {
948  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
949  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
950  }
951 
952  while (zone_end < tz_str + tz_size && char_isspace (*zone_end))
953  {
954  zone_end++;
955  }
956 
957  if (zone_end != tz_str + tz_size)
958  {
959  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
960  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
961  }
962 
963  tz_print_tz_offset (result, seconds);
964  }
965  /* Handle the main case when the timezone is a name */
966  else
967  {
968  int zone_id;
969  TZ_DECODE_INFO tzinfo;
970  DB_DATETIME dest_datetime;
971  int tdif;
972  const char *save_poz;
973  const char *end;
974 
975  save_poz = p;
976  while (p < tz_str + tz_size && !char_isspace (*p))
977  {
978  p++;
979  }
980  end = p;
981 
982  while (end < tz_str + tz_size && char_isspace (*end))
983  {
984  end++;
985  }
986  if (end != tz_str + tz_size)
987  {
988  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
989  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
990  }
991 
992  zone_id = tz_get_zone_id_by_name (save_poz, CAST_BUFLEN (p - save_poz));
993  if (zone_id == -1)
994  {
995  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
996  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
997  }
998 
999  tzinfo.type = TZ_REGION_ZONE;
1000  tzinfo.zone.zone_id = zone_id;
1001  tzinfo.zone.dst_str[0] = '\0';
1002 
1003  error = tz_datetime_utc_conv (utc_datetime, &tzinfo, true, false, &dest_datetime);
1004  if (error != NO_ERROR)
1005  {
1006  return error;
1007  }
1008 
1009  tdif =
1010  (int) (dest_datetime.date - utc_datetime->date) * 3600 * 24 + (int) (dest_datetime.time -
1011  utc_datetime->time) / 1000;
1012 
1013  tz_print_tz_offset (result, tdif);
1014  }
1015 
1016  return error;
1017 }
1018 
1019 /*
1020  * tz_create_session_tzid_for_datetime() - Creates a TZ_ID object for a DATETIME
1021  *
1022  * Returns: error code
1023  * src_dt(in): DATETIME value
1024  * src_is_utc(in): if true, than source DATETIME is considered in UTC, otherwise in in session timezone
1025  * tz_id(out): result TZ_ID
1026  */
1027 int
1028 tz_create_session_tzid_for_datetime (const DB_DATETIME * src_dt, bool src_is_utc, TZ_ID * tz_id)
1029 {
1030  TZ_DECODE_INFO tz_info;
1031  int er_status = NO_ERROR;
1032  DB_DATETIME dummy_dt;
1033  TZ_REGION session_tz_region;
1034 
1035  tz_get_session_tz_region (&session_tz_region);
1036  tz_decode_tz_region (&session_tz_region, &tz_info);
1037 
1038  /* we use tz_info which only has zone_id valid to establish correct offset and dst_id according to dt value */
1039  er_status = tz_datetime_utc_conv (src_dt, &tz_info, src_is_utc, true, &dummy_dt);
1040  if (er_status != NO_ERROR)
1041  {
1042  return er_status;
1043  }
1044 
1045  tz_encode_tz_id (&tz_info, tz_id);
1046 
1047  return er_status;
1048 }
1049 
1050 /*
1051  * tz_create_session_tzid_for_timestamp() - Creates a TZ_ID object for a TIMESTAMP
1052  *
1053  * Returns: error code
1054  * src_ts(in): TIMESTAMP value
1055  * tz_id(out): result TZ_ID
1056  *
1057  */
1058 int
1059 tz_create_session_tzid_for_timestamp (const DB_UTIME * src_ts, TZ_ID * tz_id)
1060 {
1061  DB_DATE date;
1062  DB_TIME time;
1063  DB_DATETIME dt;
1064 
1065  db_timestamp_decode_utc (src_ts, &date, &time);
1066  dt.date = date;
1067  dt.time = time * 1000;
1068 
1069  return tz_create_session_tzid_for_datetime (&dt, true, tz_id);
1070 }

1072 /*
1073  * tz_create_session_tzid_for_time() - Creates a TZ_ID object for a TIME
1074  *
1075  * Returns: error code
1076  * src_dt(in): TIME value
1077  * src_is_utc(in): if true, than source TIME is considered in UTC, otherwise in in session timezone
1078  * tz_id(out): result TZ_ID
1079  *
1080  */
1081 int
1082 tz_create_session_tzid_for_time (const DB_TIME * src_time, bool src_is_utc, TZ_ID * tz_id)
1083 {

1085 
1086  src_dt.date = tz_get_current_date ();
1087  src_dt.time = *src_time;
1088 
1089  return tz_create_session_tzid_for_datetime (&src_dt, src_is_utc, tz_id);
1090 }
1091 
1092 /*
1093  * tz_get_zone_id_by_name() - returns the ID of a timezone having the specified name or alias.
1094  *
1095  * Returns: ID of zone, or -1 if not found
1096  * name(in): timezone name or alias to search for (not null-terminated)
1097  * name_size(in): size in bytes of name
1098  */
1099 static int
1100 tz_get_zone_id_by_name (const char *name, const int name_size)
1101 {
1102  const TZ_DATA *tzd;
1103  int name_index = -1;
1104  int index_bot, index_top;
1105  int cmp_res;
1106 
1107  assert (name != NULL);
1108 
1109  tzd = tz_get_data ();
1110  if (tzd == NULL)
1111  {
1112  return -1;
1113  }
1114 
1115  index_bot = 0;
1116  index_top = tzd->name_count - 1;
1117 
1118  while (index_bot <= index_top)
1119  {
1120  name_index = (index_bot + index_top) >> 1;
1121  cmp_res = strncmp (name, tzd->names[name_index].name, name_size);
1122 
1123  if (cmp_res < 0)
1124  {
1125  index_top = name_index - 1;
1126  }
1127  else if (cmp_res > 0)
1128  {
1129  index_bot = name_index + 1;
1130  }
1131  else
1132  {
1133  if (strlen (tzd->names[name_index].name) != name_size)
1134  {
1135  index_top = name_index - 1;
1136  continue;
1137  }
1138  return name_index;
1139  }
1140  }
1141 
1142  return -1;
1143 }
1144 
1145 /*
1146  * tz_str_timezone_decode () -
1147  *
1148  * Return: error code
1149  * tz_str(in): string containing timezone information (zone, daylight saving); not null-terminated
1150  * tz_str(in): string containing timezone information (zone, daylight saving); null-terminated
1151  * tz_info(out): object containing decoded timezone info
1152  * tz_end(out): pointer to end of zone information
1153  *
1154  * Valid formats for timezone string (leading/trailing whitespaces and
1155  * leading zeros are optional) :
1156  * - " +08:00 "
1157  * - " Europe/Berlin "
1158  * - " Europe/Berlin +08:00 "
1159  */
1160 static int
1161 tz_str_timezone_decode (const char *tz_str, const int tz_str_size, TZ_DECODE_INFO * tz_info, const char **tz_end)
1162 {
1163  const char *zone_str, *tz_str_end;
1164  const char *zone_str_end;
1165  int zone_id;
1166 
1167  tz_str_end = tz_str + tz_str_size;
1168 
1169  zone_str = tz_str;
1170  while (zone_str < tz_str_end && char_isspace (*zone_str))
1171  {
1172  zone_str++;
1173  }
1174 
1175  if (zone_str >= tz_str_end)
1176  {
1177  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
1178  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
1179  }
1180 
1181  if (*zone_str == '+' || *zone_str == '-')
1182  {
1183  if (tz_str_to_seconds (zone_str, tz_str_end, &(tz_info->offset), &zone_str_end, true) != NO_ERROR)
1184  {
1185  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
1186  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
1187  }
1188  tz_info->type = TZ_REGION_OFFSET;
1189  }
1190  else
1191  {
1192  const char *dst_str, *dst_str_end, *reg_str_end;
1193  /* zone plus optional DST */
1194  reg_str_end = zone_str;
1195  while (reg_str_end < tz_str_end && !char_isspace (*reg_str_end))
1196  {
1197  reg_str_end++;
1198  }
1199 
1200  dst_str = reg_str_end;
1201  while (dst_str < tz_str_end && char_isspace (*dst_str))
1202  {
1203  dst_str++;
1204  }
1205 
1206  if (dst_str < tz_str_end)
1207  {
1208  dst_str_end = dst_str;
1209  while (dst_str_end < tz_str_end && !char_isspace (*dst_str_end))
1210  {
1211  dst_str_end++;
1212  }
1213  zone_str_end = dst_str_end;
1214  }
1215  else
1216  {
1217  zone_str_end = dst_str;
1218  dst_str = NULL;
1219  }
1220 
1221  zone_id = tz_get_zone_id_by_name (zone_str, CAST_BUFLEN (reg_str_end - zone_str));
1222  if (zone_id == -1)
1223  {
1224  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
1225  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
1226  }
1227 
1228  tz_info->type = TZ_REGION_ZONE;
1229  tz_info->zone.zone_id = zone_id;
1230  tz_info->zone.dst_id = TZ_DS_ID_MAX;
1231  tz_info->zone.offset_id = TZ_OFFSET_ID_MAX;
1232 
1233  if (dst_str != NULL)
1234  {
1235  if (dst_str_end - dst_str > (int) sizeof (tz_info->zone.dst_str))
1236  {
1237  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_DST, 0);
1238  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
1239  }
1240 
1241  strncpy (tz_info->zone.dst_str, dst_str, dst_str_end - dst_str);
1242  tz_info->zone.dst_str[dst_str_end - dst_str] = '\0';
1243  zone_str = dst_str_end;
1244  }
1245  else
1246  {
1247  tz_info->zone.dst_str[0] = '\0';
1248  }
1249  }
1250 
1251  if (tz_end != NULL)
1252  {
1253  while (zone_str_end < tz_str_end && char_isspace (*zone_str_end))
1254  {
1255  zone_str_end++;
1256  }
1257  *tz_end = zone_str_end;
1258  }
1259 
1260  return NO_ERROR;
1261 }
1262 
1263 /*
1264  * tz_str_to_region ()
1265  *
1266  * Return: error code
1267  * tz_str(in): string containing timezone information (zone, daylight saving); not null-terminated
1268  * tz_str_size(in): size in characters of zone information of tz_str
1269  * tz_region(out): object containing timezone info
1270  *
1271  * Valid formats for timezone string (leading/trailing white-spaces and leading zeros are optional) :
1272  * - " +08:00 "
1273  * - " Europe/Berlin "
1274  * - " Europe/Berlin +08:00 "
1275  */
1276 int
1277 tz_str_to_region (const char *tz_str, const int tz_str_size, TZ_REGION * tz_region)
1278 {
1279  const char *zone_str, *tz_str_end;
1280  const char *zone_str_end;
1281  int reg_zone_id, reg_offset;
1282  TZ_REGION_TYPE reg_type;
1283 
1284  tz_str_end = tz_str + tz_str_size;
1285  zone_str = tz_str;
1286 
1287  while (zone_str < tz_str_end && char_isspace (*zone_str))
1288  {
1289  zone_str++;
1290  }
1291 
1292  if (zone_str >= tz_str_end)
1293  {
1294  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
1295  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
1296  }
1297 
1298  if (*zone_str == '+' || *zone_str == '-')
1299  {
1300  if (tz_str_to_seconds (zone_str, tz_str_end, &reg_offset, &zone_str_end, true) != NO_ERROR)
1301  {
1302  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
1303  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
1304  }
1305 
1306  while (zone_str_end < tz_str_end && char_isspace (*zone_str_end))
1307  {
1308  zone_str_end++;
1309  }
1310 
1311  if (zone_str_end != tz_str_end)
1312  {
1313  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
1314  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
1315  }
1316 
1317  reg_type = TZ_REGION_OFFSET;
1318  }
1319  else
1320  {
1321  const char *reg_str_end;
1322 
1323  reg_str_end = zone_str;
1324  while (reg_str_end < tz_str_end && !char_isspace (*reg_str_end))
1325  {
1326  reg_str_end++;
1327  }
1328 
1329  reg_zone_id = tz_get_zone_id_by_name (zone_str, CAST_BUFLEN (reg_str_end - zone_str));
1330  if (reg_zone_id == -1)
1331  {
1332  er_set (ER_ERROR_SEVERITY, ARG_FILE_LINE, ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE, 0);
1333  return ER_TZ_INVALID_TIMEZONE;
1334  }
1335 
1336  reg_type = TZ_REGION_ZONE;
1337  }
1338 
1339  if (tz_region != NULL)
1340  {
1341  tz_region->type = reg_type;
1342  if (reg_type == TZ_REGION_OFFSET)
1343  {
1344  tz_region->offset = reg_offset;
1345  }
1346  else
1347  {
1348  tz_region->zone_id = reg_zone_id;
1349  }
1350  }
1351 
1352  return NO_ERROR;
1353 }
1354 
1355 /*
1356  * tz_create_datetimetz () - transforms a DATETIME and timezone string (or default timezone identifier) into a DATETIME
1357  * (in UTC) with timezone info, considering the source DATETIME in specified timezone
1358  *
1359  * Return: error code
1360  * dt(in): decoded local datetime value (as appears in the user string)
1361  * tz_str(in): string containing timezone information (zone, daylight saving);
1362  * null-terminated, can be NULL, in which case default_tz_region is used
1363  * tz_size(in): size of tz_str
1364  * default_tz_region(in): default timezone region to apply if input string does not contain a valid zone information
1365  * dt_tz(out): object containing datetime value (adjusted to UTC) and timezone info
1366  * end_tz_str(out): pointer to end of parsed string
1367  *
1368  * Valid formats for timezone string (leading/trailing white-spaces and leading zero are optional) :
1369  * - " +08:00 "
1370  * - " Europe/Berlin "
1371  * - " Europe/Berlin +08:00 "
1372  */
1373 int
1374 tz_create_datetimetz (const DB_DATETIME * dt, const char *tz_str, const int tz_size,
1375  const TZ_REGION * default_tz_region, DB_DATETIMETZ * dt_tz, const char **end_tz_str)
1376 {
1377  int err_status = NO_ERROR;
1378  DB_DATETIME utc_dt;
1379  TZ_DECODE_INFO tz_info;
1380 
1381  if (end_tz_str != NULL)
1382  {
1383  *end_tz_str = NULL;
1384  }
1385 
1386  if (tz_str != NULL)
1387  {
1388  err_status = tz_str_timezone_decode (tz_str, tz_size, &tz_info, end_tz_str);
1389  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
1390  {
1391  goto exit;
1392  }
1393  }
1394  else
1395  {
1396  tz_decode_tz_region (default_tz_region, &tz_info);
1397  }
1398 
1399  err_status = tz_datetime_utc_conv (dt, &tz_info, false, false, &utc_dt);
1400  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
1401  {
1402  goto exit;
1403  }
1404  tz_encode_tz_id (&tz_info, &(dt_tz->tz_id));
1405  dt_tz->datetime = utc_dt;
1406 
1407 exit:
1408  return err_status;
1409 }

1411 /*
1412  * tz_create_timestamptz () - creates a timestamp with timezone from date and time values considering the user timezone
1413  * from tz_str; if this is NULL, then default_tz_region is used
1414  *
1415  * Return: error code
1416  * date(in): local date
1417  * time(in): local time
1418  * tz_str(in): string containing timezone information (zone, daylight saving);
1419  * null-terminated, can be NULL, in which case default_tz_region is used
1420  * tz_size(in): size of tz_str
1421  * default_tz_region(in): default timezone region to apply if input string does not contain a valid zone information
1422  * ts_tz(out): object containing timestamp value and timezone info
1423  *
1424  */
1425 int
1426 tz_create_timestamptz (const DB_DATE * date, const DB_TIME * time, const char *tz_str, const int tz_size,
1427  const TZ_REGION * default_tz_region, DB_TIMESTAMPTZ * ts_tz, const char **end_tz_str)
1428 {
1429  int err_status = NO_ERROR;
1430  DB_DATETIME utc_dt, dt;
1431  TZ_DECODE_INFO tz_info;
1432  DB_DATE date_utc;
1433  DB_TIME time_utc;
1434 
1435  if (end_tz_str != NULL)
1436  {
1437  *end_tz_str = NULL;
1438  }
1439 
1440  if (tz_str != NULL)
1441  {
1442  err_status = tz_str_timezone_decode (tz_str, tz_size, &tz_info, end_tz_str);
1443  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
1444  {
1445  goto exit;
1446  }
1447  }
1448  else
1449  {
1450  tz_decode_tz_region (default_tz_region, &tz_info);
1451  }
1452 
1453  dt.date = *date;
1454  dt.time = (*time) * 1000;
1455 
1456  err_status = tz_datetime_utc_conv (&dt, &tz_info, false, false, &utc_dt);
1457  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
1458  {
1459  goto exit;
1460  }
1461  date_utc = utc_dt.date;
1462  time_utc = utc_dt.time / 1000;
1463 
1464  err_status = db_timestamp_encode_utc (&date_utc, &time_utc, &ts_tz->timestamp);
1465  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
1466  {
1467  goto exit;
1468  }
1469  tz_encode_tz_id (&tz_info, &(ts_tz->tz_id));
1470 
1471 exit:
1472  return err_status;
1473 }

1506 /*
1507  * tz_conv_tz_time_w_zone_name() - Converts the time_source from timezone source zone into timezone dest_zone
1508  *
1509  *
1510  * Return: error code
1511  * time_source(in): object containing source time value
1512  * source_zone(in): source timezone string
1513  * len_source(in): length of source timezone string
1514  * dest_zone(in): destination timezone string
1515  * len_dest(in): length of destination timezone string
1516  * time_dest(out): object containing output time value
1517  */
1518 int
1519 tz_conv_tz_time_w_zone_name (const DB_TIME * time_source, const char *source_zone, int len_source,
1520  const char *dest_zone, int len_dest, DB_TIME * time_dest)
1521 {
1522  int err_status = NO_ERROR;
1523  DB_DATETIME src_dt, dest_dt;
1524  TZ_REGION source, dest;
1525 
1526  err_status = tz_str_to_region (source_zone, len_source, &source);
1527  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
1528  {
1529  return err_status;
1530  }
1531 
1532  err_status = tz_str_to_region (dest_zone, len_dest, &dest);
1533  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
1534  {
1535  return err_status;
1536  }
1537 
1538  src_dt.date = tz_get_current_date ();
1539  src_dt.time = (*time_source) * 1000;
1540 
1541  err_status = tz_conv_tz_datetime_w_region (&src_dt, &source, &dest, &dest_dt, NULL, NULL);
1542  if (err_status != NO_ERROR)
1543  {
1544  return err_status;
1545  }
1546 
1547  *time_dest = dest_dt.time / 1000;
1548 
1549  return err_status;
1550 }
